name: A GAMEMASTER1967 Quiz | Words in Words for Kids | 10 Questions

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 6-letter word for a small river.
questions.explanation:
Stream.

	A stream is like a small river.  It can also mean a flow, like the water in a hose making a stream through the yard.  It also means to pour, like when you pour water into a container, there is a stream of water going into the container.

questions.text: Find a 4-letter word, using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", that means a sports group that works together.
questions.explanation:
Team.

	A team is a group of people who work together, like a sports team.  For instance, in a football team, the quarterback might throw the ball to another team member, who will then run with the ball to try to get a touchdown.  Meanwhile, the other team members stop the opposing team from tackling the runner.  If the team does not work together, they might fail!

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 4-letter word for a door that is built in a fence.
questions.explanation:
Gate.

	A gate is like a door, but it swings open from a fence.  A gate allows you to go into the fenced in area.  There are many other types of gates, but the gate in a fence is perhaps the most common.

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 4-letter word for a shining object in the night sky.
questions.explanation:
Star.

	When you look up to the sky on a dark night, you can see stars.  There are billions of stars in the galaxy.  A star is also someone who is famous, like an actor or a singer.

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 3-letter word for a large rodent.
questions.explanation:
Rat.

	A rat is a rodent that many people think of as pests, but some keep rats as pets.  Rats' teeth never stop growing, so they often chew things up.  This can be very annoying, especially if a rat gnaws through the wire that allows you to play on FunTrivia!

questions.text: Find a 3-letter word, using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", that is a number describing how old someone is.
questions.explanation:
Age.

	At the time of writing this quiz, I am 18 years old, so my "age" is 18.  Someone who is 45 years old can be called 45 years of age.  Many people ask "how old are you?" or "what's your age?" which mean the same thing.

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 4-letter word meaing something that is similar, or identical.
questions.explanation:
Same.

	If something is the same, it is usually similar, or even identical, to something else.  For instance, my eyes are the "same" color as my sisters'; so that means our eyes are identical in color.

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 3-letter word for a state of matter, like solid and liquid.
questions.explanation:
Gas.

	There are three main states of matter.  States of matter are things that occupy space, like coffee, air, and toilet paper.  The three states of matter are solid, liquid, and gas.  The coffee is a liquid, the toilet paper is a solid, and air is a gas!

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 4-letter word for a drop of water that comes out of your eyes when you cry, or when you rip something.
questions.explanation:
Tear.

	When "tear" is pronounced one way (rhyming with "here"), it means the water that comes from your eyes when you cry.  When it is pronounced another way (rhyming with "there"), it means to rip something, like a piece of paper.

questions.text: Using only letters in "GAMEMASTER", find a 4-letter word for a direction, like north and south.
questions.explanation:
East.

	There are four common directions, all of which can be found on a compass or a GPS.  These directions are north, south, east, and west.  Only "east" can be spelled using the letters in "GAMEMASTER".
